bug.short_desc: large sieve scripts cause sieveshell issues

long_desc.thetext: Large sieve scripts (over the quota limit) can cause very strange behavior, such as broken pipes (in the case of this happening on a referral), or other error messages that may not be clear.
Created an attachment (id=91) sample sieve script which replicates this problem

Created an attachment (id=92) actual script that replicates this problem
the first script wasn't the full length necessary.
note also that the script has parse errors.

in the referral case whats going on is pretty clear, sieveshell dumps the entire text of a large file over the network, but the timsieved closes the connection by sending the referral before the data dump is complete, giving a "broken pipe" to sieveshell.

In the regluar (non-referral) case, we weren't eating the input after we decided that the literal size was too big (the problems with non-synchronizing literals!)
so I committed code to do that. still need to fix the referral case though.
fixed for issueing referrals as well.

attachment.desc: sample sieve script which replicates this problem
actual script that replicates this problem
